column3: I would advise against using RBMs nowadays. If you want to pre-train a deep autoencoder, you can just train shallow autoencoders to do that. It will work just as well as training an RBM and it's much simpler conceptually and in terms of implementation. But depending on the problem, pre-training may be unnecessary anyway. Just build a deep autoencoder with ReLUs and possibly dropout and you should be able to train that end-to-end in many cases.
